newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat closes broadly lower on hedging.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat closes broadly lower on hedging.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended broadly lower on harvest-related hedge pressure, late selling by ADM and LFG and on signs of improved world wheat production, traders said.
"We're finally seeing some major hedge-pressure," said a trader, who explained that farmers had so far been reluctant to sell wheat at current price levels.

More pressure came from the International Grain Council's upwardly revised estimate of 1996 world wheat output. The IGC pegged world wheat production at 563 million tonnes, up from the previous forecast of 560 million tonnes.
MGE spring wheat closed five to 9-3/4 cents per bushel lower, with Sept down 6-1/4 cents at $4.59-3/4. Dec wheat was hammered by heavy selling late and ended down 7-3/4 cents at $4.47-1/2 per bushel.
ADM reportedly sold one million March and two million Dec bushels late. LFG sold one million Sept and 3.5 million Dec, and Benson Quinn sold one million Dec, traders said.
MGE barley closed two to 20 cents per hundredweight lower, with nearby Sept down 20 cents at $7.40.
The Minneapolis Grain Exchange will be closed Monday in observance of the Labor Day holiday.
